data: {"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3563687,"name":"JohnRRRR","username":"JohnRRRR","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/j/94ad74/{size}.png","created_at":"2025-03-21T01:12:33.718Z","cooked":"\u003cp\u003eIn the past we were in the habit of reflashing the firmware on the OpenMesh radios after events but that does not appear to be necessary with the Vivid radios. We were able to tether and connect to 10.TE.\u003cspan class=\"abbreviation\"\u003eAM\u003ctemplate class=\"tooltiptext\" data-text=\"AndyMark\"\u003e\u003c/template\u003e\u003c/span\u003e.1 and access the config page. Firmware listed on the status page matched the current download. We set the SSID and WPA passwords, hit configure and seemed to be done. Our second radio connected after rebooting. Does that sound correct or is the event firmware a special version that needs to be replaced?\u003c/p\u003e","post_number":1,"post_type":1,"posts_count":3,"updated_at":"2025-03-21T01:12:33.718Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":8,"reads":96,"readers_count":95,"score":59.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":496401,"topic_slug":"programming-vivid-radio-after-event","display_username":"JohnRRRR","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":27328,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/programming-vivid-radio-after-event/496401/1","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null,"can_vote":false},{"id":3563701,"name":"Joseph Walters","username":"Jwal","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/jwal/{size}/228161_2.png","created_at":"2025-03-21T01:27:09.673Z","cooked":"\u003cp\u003eYour all good. It’s just that simple™.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003eEvent firmware is the same as at home firmware currently. You can even go update it to the latest before your event, and that’s generally encouraged because if there is a recent update, it will make your time at the radio config.
